home.title: Home
home.lastKmsgDesc: last_kmsg contains a dmesg + bootloader log of the last time your device was rebooted (intentionally or through a crash). It's useful for diagnosing kernel panics and crashes.
home.dmesgDesc: dmesg shows the current kernel ring buffer (logs). This is useful for diagnosing issues that occurred after boot.
home.tooltipUnsupported: This kernel version is too old and may not be fully compatible with this module. Please update your kernel.

features.title: Features
features.tooltipReboot: The running kernel's value and boot partition's value are mismatched! A reboot might be pending to apply changes.
features.tooltipReadOnlyAllowed: Changing this feature's state is temporarily allowed, but will not be saved.
features.tooltipReadOnlyBlocked: This feature's state cannot be changed from the UI normally (read-only).

zram.title: ZRAM
zram.disableWarningBody: This will have a major negative impact on performance and your device may experience freezes.
zram.disableWarningNote: Only disable ZRAM if you know what you are doing!

tooltip.zram: Compressed RAM block device. Helps multitasking by compressing data in RAM. Usually, higher size translates to more apps fitting in ZRAM.
tooltip.memory: Settings to control the Linux Virtual Memory (VM) subsystem. Adjusts how the kernel balances performance, battery life, and multitasking.
tooltip.ioScheduler: Algorithm used to order and merge I/O requests. Affects storage performance and latency.

modal.experimentalBody:
Features exposed by enabling this toggle might be unfinished, unsupported, or dangerous.

Proceed with caution.
modal.readonlyBody:
This allows patching features marked as read-only.

Use only for testing. Changes will NOT be saved.
modal.applyChangesBody:
This will flash the feature-patched kernel to your device.

This involves risks.
modal.rebootPendingBody:
Are you sure you want to {action}?

You have unapplied changes that will be lost!
